documentation.text:
@dev sets the SLARegistry contract address and can only be called
 once

devdoc.details: This contract is attached immediately after deployment to a SLARegistry

SLIReceived(address,uint256,bytes32,uint.details: event emitted when having a response from Chainlink with the SLI

constructor.details: parameterize the variables according to network

params._chainlinkOracle: the address of the oracle to create requests to
params._chainlinkToken: the address of LINK token contract
params._jobId: the job id for the HTTPGet job

fulfillSLI(bytes32,uint256).details: callback function for the Chainlink SLI request which stores the SLI in the SLA contract

params._requestId: the ID of the ChainLink request
params._sliValue: the SLI value returned by ChainLink

getPeriod(address,uint256).details: gets the start and end of a given SLA on a given period

requestSLI(uint256,address,bytes32).details: creates a ChainLink request to get a new SLI value for the given params. Can only be called by the SLARegistry contract or Chainlink Oracle.

params._sloName: the SLO name to get the SLI value for

setSLARegistry().details: sets the SLARegistry contract address and can only be called once

SLARegistry.details: The address of the SLARegistry contract

fee.details: fee for Chainlink querys. Currently 0.1 LINK

requestIdToRequest.details: Mapping that stores chainlink request information

devdoc.title: Messenger

methods.constructor: sets the Chainlink parameters (oracle address, token address, jobId) and sets the SLARegistry to 0x0 address

userdoc.notice: Messenger is a contract to interact with an Oracle and request SLI information to Stacktical API on a decentralized fashion. Is not meant to be interacted directly.
